references.paper_title: Deep unsupervised learning using nonequilibrium thermodynamics
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of denoising diffusion probabilistic models, providing the theoretical basis for many subsequent works.
This paper introduced the core denoising diffusion probabilistic model (DDPM), a highly influential model in the field of generative modeling that the current paper builds upon.
This paper introduced DDIM, an improvement over DDPM that allows for more efficient sampling, and it is directly relevant to the algorithms explored in the current paper.
This paper is among the first to directly apply diffusion models to image restoration, a key application area of the current work, providing a crucial link between the two concepts.

references.paper_title: Zero-shot image restoration using denoising diffusion null-space model
references.reason: This paper presents a novel method of zero-shot image restoration that is closely related to the method proposed in this paper and provides an important comparison point for evaluating its performance.
